page.title: 09THE BEACH
page.content: Near a fence slightly east of Rampside on the seashore the beach consists baasically of shingle. The further towards the sea you go the boggier it becomes and eventually it is a muddy marsh covered in clumps of coarse grass. Here the concrete floord barrier is shattered into huge boulders. The shingle is strewn with litter; old shoes, rusty cans, bags, crisp packets and empty bottles. The father N.E. you go the shingle recedes and eventually there is marsh all the way up to the barrier. the marsh is rich in life; little fish live in the pools between the grass clumps and crabs live among the grass. As you turn a corner the marsh disappears and the beach becomes a vast expanse of sand and shingle. There is very dense vegetation above the barrier; brambles, hawthorns and many flowers.
